subject: Re: fRANK? Re: [EVP-ITC] The Ghost man message
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-11965839-1202706779=:81662

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Longer messages too overall? Seems that way to me they have gotten longer and more detailed using linear. Less jumpy sounding and more fluid as well.  Just an observation.
  I think easier for people to hear than other methods sometimes, not always but some people hear those voices better.
   
  Misty

purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
          Yeah, the Ghostman, or my version of the Mini Box is linear sweep 
using a triangle wave form voltage to tune the radio up, and back 
down the band. 
I had the same experience at first with this mode, at first it was 
gibberish, then all the sudden BAM!, I could hear them, and I like it 
much better that the random mode I was using. I like it so much I 
abandoned random.

Frank-S 

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ron Lederer <ronriko@...> wrote:
>
> Frank Do you mean "linear: sweep? Or what? very interesting 
file. I needed to listen to it several times until the words clearly 
poped out. Somethng like the special art work (don't know its 
definition) that buildis in scenes hidden within the obvious 
subject. Very fun to discover. Ron L 
> 
> Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote: With linear, 
the messges tend to be longer. 
> 
> Frank-S
